summary: The documents provided mention individuals with the surname Bishop, including a list of CIA employees named Bishop with their employment history and physical descriptions. Two memoranda from S. D. Breckinridge to Ray Reardon request photographs of Agency employees with the surname Bishop who were employed in the 1960s. These photographs were requested to assist witnesses in identifying a man named Morris Bishop. While Whit Moore Bishop is mentioned as one of the individuals in the Bishop Personnel Records, the documents primarily focus on gathering information about individuals with the surname Bishop for the purpose of identifying Morris Bishop.
significance: The significance of Whit Moore Bishop in the JFK context, based on these documents, is minimal. The documents suggest an investigation or inquiry involving individuals with the surname Bishop, specifically to identify Morris Bishop. Whit Moore Bishop is simply one of the individuals listed in the Bishop Personnel Records.
